content: In preparation for next week’s steering meeting, I’m going to be reviewing the set of P-high issues. E.g. trying to identify categories and sort them accordingly. I’ll try to take notes in here as I go.

(I’m currently wondering what online service will be best for free-form note taking. I’m namely wondering whether I want some sort of virtual note cards / kanban board thing, rather than working in a 1-d text system.)
though maybe mermaid in hackmd would suffice...
I've used hackmd to triage issues in the past. It works decently well
Finished initial pass, with this so far: https://hackmd.io/YY3u0dkURtiQHDVX0hEImA?view
I’m going to back over the list again and add some more metadata
(effectively create a third column in the rendered graph, I hope)
So many traits issues though :upside_down:
What is the difference between needs-test1 and needs-test2
I’m just trying to make the presentation better
it was too hard to read with so many arcs going to one box.
but maybe I’ll go back to the other way. Not sure yet. (Other approach would be to embed the metadata directly in each box. Maybe I’ll do both,that mght make sense….)
wow some of these renderings are just showing how weak mermaid’s layout algorithm is
(I’m going to try a different approach for adding these bits of metadata)
